snippet: The Japanese supplier has dug in its heels on efforts to expand recalls, and Honda said it planned a wider recall, regardless of Takata’s stance.
abstract: Honda Motors executive vice president Rick Schostek tells House lawmakers that company will take action on its own to address faulty airbags made by Takata and use replacements from other suppliers if necessary; Takata has continued to resist demands that it expand recall of its airbags nationwide.

byline.original: By AARON M. KESSLER and HIROKO TABUCHI
byline.contributor: Aaron M. Kessler reported from Washington and Hiroko Tabuchi from New York. Danielle Ivory and Rebecca R. Ruiz contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Japanese supplier has dug in its heels on efforts to expand recalls, and Honda said it planned a wider recall, regardless of Takata’s stance.

headline.main: Honda to Expand Airbag Recall Nationwide as Takata Resists
headline.print_headline: Honda Decides to Expand Airbag Recall as a Defiant Takata Resists
